Rowland Hussey Macy Sr. founded the department store chain R.H. Macy & Company in 1858 in New York City. The store was established on Sixth Avenue between 13th and 14th Streets, which was far north of where other dry goods stores were at the time. On the company's first day of business on October 28, 1858, sales totaled $11.08. Macy's logo has always included a star, which comes from a tattoo that Macy got as a teenager when he worked on a Nantucket whaling ship.
